datasetVersion.termsOfUse: Permission from the Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE) is required to download data files for this project. Attribution is required for use of the data with the statement: The authors acknowledge the Alberta Research Centre (ARCHE) at the University of Alberta for collecting and sharing the data analyzed for this work.

fields.value: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

dsDescriptionValue.value: We conducted a cross-sectional quantitative analysis to examine the impact of selective database searching on results of meta-analyses. Our sample included systematic reviews with at least one meta-analysis from three Cochrane Review Groups.

publicationCitation.value: Hartling L, Featherstone RM, Nuspl M, Shave K, Dryden D, & Vandermeer B. (2016). The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study. BMC Medical Research Methodology. [In review].

distributorName.value: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

files.description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) review group.
files.label: ARI_DBs.xlsx

datasetVersion.citation: Hartling, Lisa; Featherstone, Robin; Nuspl, Megan; Shave, Kassi; Dryden, Donna; Vandermeer, Ben, 2016, "The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10866, UAL Dataverse, V1
